sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to union.
message_1: Let set A = {1, 2} and set B = {3, 4}. Find the Cartesian product of A and B, then find the union of the resulting set. Next, find the Cartesian product of B and A, and find the union of that resulting set as well. Show that the union of the first resulting set is not equal to the union of the second resulting set, thus proving that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to union.
